Our results suggest that fruits from the investigated plants contain compounds with beneficial effects on human health that also have a high benchmark value on the market. This is the case of rutin, which is commonly known as a natural anti-inflammatory and antidiabetic compound
42 , stilbenes ( trans-piceid and picetannol) known for their antimicrobial, anti-inflammatory, and antitumoral interest
43 , and hydroxycinnamic acids, such as chlorogenic and caffeic acids for which beneficial properties have been recognized as well
44 . Moreover, some of these metabolites show a high stability during gastric digestion, as is the case of piceid and rutin, which are glycolsylated and therefore protected during gastric digestion
45 . These two molecules are converted in the gut into the corresponding aglycones resveratrol and quercetin, which are polyphenols displaying a variety of biological activities in humans
46, 47 and are used as active components of several food supplements commercially available. This condition enhances the potential nutraceutical value of these extracts and supports their exploitation through bioprospecting.
